title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS that helps users monitor and manage their sleep debt. This project allows users to log their sleep hours and compare them to their desired sleep schedule, providing insights into their sleep patterns and potential sleep debt accumulation. Focusing on practical application and leveraging TypeScript for enhanced code maintainability, this repository serves as a personal project exploring web development and sleep management techniques.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, built using LaTeX for professional formatting and HTML for online accessibility. It serves as a personal project to showcase my skills and experience in a clear and structured manner, demonstrating proficiency in both document preparation and web development technologies.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-Event-Calendar is a JavaScript-based project creating a customizable and interactive event calendar. Built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, this repository provides a foundation for displaying and managing events in a user-friendly format. It offers dynamic event loading and manipulation capabilities, allowing users to easily view, add, and modify scheduled activities.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository contains a modern IoT asset tracking application built with Next.js, TypeScript, TailwindCSS, and Supabase. It provides a user-friendly interface for monitoring and managing physical assets, leveraging real-time data to enhance visibility and optimize operational efficiency. The project demonstrates best practices for building full-stack applications with these technologies, offering a valuable resource for developers interested in IoT solutions and modern web development.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack web application built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI), serving as a project management and collaboration tool. This project leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and state management, demonstrating best practices for building modern web applications with a focus on type safety and maintainability. Key topics covered include component-driven development, server-side rendering, and efficient API interactions.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project leveraging HTML and Python to generate interactive and informative map visualizations. This repository focuses on building tools to display geographical data and insights, offering a practical application of web development and data visualization techniques within the broader topic of project-based learning.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python (Flask framework) for managing and interacting with data stored in a PostgreSQL database. This project utilizes HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting to create a dynamic web interface for performing create, read, update, and delete operations, showcasing a practical example of web development best practices and database integration.

title: next-voting
description: Next-Voting is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript to create a streamlined and user-friendly voting application. Leveraging modern web technologies, this repository explores practical implementation of voting mechanisms, focusing on creating a robust and engaging user experience.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a dynamic project built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to serve as a collaborative idea-sharing and brainstorming platform. It allows users to easily capture, organize, and prioritize project ideas, fostering a more efficient and creative workflow. Leveraging modern web development practices, this project aims to provide a user-friendly and engaging experience for teams looking to generate and refine innovative concepts.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built using a combination of JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this project provides an intuitive interface to parse, filter, and display log data, making debugging and performance analysis of ROS-based systems significantly easier. This project aims to streamline the ROS development workflow by offering a user-friendly way to understand system behavior through comprehensive log analysis.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a personal project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focused on showcasing interactive web development skills. This repository contains the source code for a dynamic website exploring concepts related to [insert key feature if mentioned in README, e.g., data visualization, user authentication, a specific API integration]. It serves as a portfolio piece demonstrating proficiency in front-end development and web technologies.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based dashboard built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, designed to visualize and interact with data from a robotic system. This project aims to provide a user-friendly interface for monitoring robot status, visualizing sensor data, and potentially controlling robot actions, leveraging web technologies to offer accessibility and real-time updates.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository provides a functional and visually appealing dashboard template, demonstrating best practices for structuring a Next.js application and utilizing TypeScript for enhanced type safety and maintainability. It serves as a valuable starting point or learning resource for developers looking to build data-driven web applications with a focus on user experience and clean code.

description: Raven-v2 is a project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, focusing on [Insert the project's specific purpose here, e.g., creating a streamlined note-taking application, developing a real-time collaborative coding platform, etc.]. This repository encompasses [Mention key aspects or features from the README, e.g., a modular architecture, a focus on user experience, integration with external APIs, etc.] and serves as a personal exploration into modern web development practices.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, provides practical project examples for learning and applying financial analysis techniques. It explores various financial topics and demonstrates how to use Python to solve real-world financial problems, making it a valuable resource for anyone looking to enhance their financial modeling and data analysis skills with Python.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, leveraging Express.js for the backend, Vite.js for the frontend, and styled with CSS. It utilizes the Gemini API to enable engaging and interactive conversations, serving as a project showcase demonstrating modern web development practices and a practical application of AI-powered communication. The project explores topics surrounding the integration of AI models within web applications and provides a template for future projects using similar technologies.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a modern e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (utilizing the Pages Router) and TypeScript, showcasing a seamless online shopping experience for fruits. The application leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, Material UI (MUI) for a polished and responsive user interface, and strong typing throughout for maintainability and scalability, demonstrating best practices in contemporary web development.
